Company - AWS EMEA SARL (Italy Branch) - G99

Job ID: A2660970

Title: Data Scientist
HTML:
Cosa ti proponiamo

All’interno della divisione Data & Analytics nella Business Line AI & Advanced Analytics, siamo alla ricerca di un Data Scientist per progettualità legate al Machine Learning, AI e Data Science nella nostra unità di sviluppo di LLM proprietari.

Quali saranno le tue attività e responsabilità?

Sarai Responsabile Di Attività Di Analisi, Sviluppo e Implementazione Di Soluzioni Avanzate Di Basate Sul Machine Learning, AI e Generative AI All’interno Di Un Team Di Data Scientist Ed AI Engineer. In Particolare, Ti Occuperai Delle Seguenti Attività

  • Progettare e sviluppare soluzioni di AI/ML robuste e scalabili;
  • Ottimizzare algoritmi e modelli di AI/ML;
  • Supportare la gestione dell'intero ciclo di vita di progetti di Data Science e Artificial Intelligence, dalla concezione al deployment;
  • Redigere e mantenere la documentazione tecniche relativa a Soluzioni e Modelli di AI.

Qualifiche e competenze richieste

Qualifiche Richieste

  • Almeno due anni di esperienza nello sviluppo di soluzioni Python con le principali librerie per il Machine Learning (es. Scikit Learn) e per la visualizzazione (es. Matplotlib, Plotly, Bokeh, ecc.);
  • Esperienza nell’uso di framework di deep learning e NLP (es. PyTorch, Hugging Face, Langchain);
  • Esperienza nell’uso di sistemi di versionamento del codice (es. GIT);
  • Conoscenza delle principali tecniche di valutazione delle performance di Algoritmi di AI;
  • Familiarità nello sviluppo di API, basate su architetture a microservizi;
  • Familiarità nell’uso di tecnologie cloud a supporto dello sviluppo dello sviluppo di soluzioni di AI, su almeno uno dei principali hyperscaler (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud Platform);
  • Laurea in discipline informatiche, ingegneristiche o statistiche (Master o specializzazione in ambito Data Science vengono considerati un plus):
  • Buone capacità comunicative e di presentazione.

Competenze Aggiuntive Preferenziali

  • Conoscenze di base della teoria dei modelli generativi e LLM;
  • Conoscenza di framework e best practice per il serving LLM in Production (es. vLLM, LLMOps,
  • Pachyderm);
  • Esperienza nella creazione di soluzioni basate su container tramite l’uso di strumenti di virtualizzazione e scaling (es. Docker, Kubernetes);
  • Conoscenza delle piattaforme Cloudera e Databricks;
  • Conoscenza del framework Ray per il calcolo distribuito;
  • Esperienza nella redazione di documentazione tecnica;

Cosa cerchiamo nelle nostre persone?

  • Ambizione, nel perseguire grandi obiettivi e nell'investire sul miglioramento continuo;
  • Proattività, nell’anticipare e affrontare le sfide con iniziativa;
  • Trasparenza, nel comunicare apertamente e fornire feedback costruttivi;
  • Motivazione a migliorare e a crescere insieme agli altri, manifestando apertura al confronto per favorire la crescita collettiva e il raggiungimento degli obiettivi comuni.

Invia la tua candidatura e raccontaci come puoi fare la differenza. 

SEDE DI INSERIMENTO

Milano | Roma | Torino | Padova

L’annuncio è rivolto a tutti i candidati, senza distinzione di sesso, nel rispetto del Codice delle pari opportunità di cui al D.Lgs. 198/2006 e ss.mm.ii.

Title: Data Scientist Senior
HTML:
NTT DATA, Trusted Global Innovator, è tra i principali player a livello mondiale in ambito IT services. Con più di 140.000 professionisti in oltre 50 Paesi in tutto il mondo, siamo protagonisti e acceleratori della trasformazione digitale offrendo ai nostri clienti soluzioni tecnologiche e innovative progettate su misura. Il motore di NTTDATA sono le persone, ognuna con la propria unicità, talento ed attitudine. Abbiamo costruito una Smile Working Company in cui la cura, l’ascolto delle persone, il loro benessere e sviluppo delle competenze sono la nostra priorità. Abbiamo creato spazi di lavoro che favoriscono il senso di comunità e lo scambio costruttivo di esperienze.

Guardiamo al nostro domani con la stessa passione di ieri e abbiamo bisogno anche del tuo talento!

www.nttdata.com/it

Responsibilities

The ideal candidate as Senior Data Scientist in NTT DATA will have a mix of skills including Generative AI hands-on capability (preferably on Azure/GCP and on-premise) engineering best practices, statistical expertise, Machine and Deep Learning skills and a strong business sense.

The Senior Data Scientist will work with fellow data scientists, data engineers, ML Engineers, product managers, business analysts, and stakeholders from other internal groups and from external clients.

He/She will be responsible for multiple projects, leading the Data Scientists and connecting with the stakeholders on client?s side, to ensure that tasks are on time and well executed.

Required Skills

  • Experience of at least 3-5 years as data scientist;
  • Strong Python (mandatory) and SQL coding;
  • Knowledge of Java/Scala or C++/R is a plus;
  • Tensorflow and Pytorch knowledge with a focus over Computer Vision solutions;
  • Knowledge of ML solutions architecture and Generative AI pipelines;
  • Cloud and hybrid ML implementations;
  • Incorporate new, cutting edge business intelligence, machine learning, and alternative data practices into wider organization to drive efficiencies and generate revenue;
  • Own the full stack execution of data science projects from data wrangling, model development, presentation, measurement to deployment;
  • Work with data engineers to produce fully productionized pipelines including data ingestion, cleaning, feature engineering and model training/prediction;
  • Conduct research and analysis into reinsurance and advisory products to augment industry-standard models and develop new market offerings;
  • Establish and maintain strong relationships with internal team members and external clients


Location: Milano, Bari, Bologna, Cosenza, Napoli, Roma, Salerno, Torino

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Quale sarà la tua sfida? 

Bip ha creato all’interno del proprio Competence Centre “xTech” il più nutrito gruppo di Data Scientist in Italia (fonte: statistiche LinkedIn), e dall’Italia coordina anche i propri gruppi di Data Scientist locali presso le proprie sedi estere. 

Nell’ambito della continua crescita ed evoluzione di questo effervescente gruppo, che opera sui nostri clienti in tutti i settori, e ci ha consentito di introdurre l’Intelligenza Artificiale presso le realtà enterprise più importanti d’Italia, siamo alla ricerca sia di profili junior/intermediate (dai neolaureati a profili con almeno 2 anni di esperienza), sia profili middle-senior (dai 3 ai 5 anni di esperienza). La provenienza da società di consulenza direzionale o informatica sarà considerata un forte plus. 

Il/La Data Scientist in Bip evolve non solo le proprie competenze di AI e Machine Learning, ma anche la comprensione dei fenomeni legati al Business dei nostri Clienti e le proprie capacità di tradurli in algoritmi e poi di comunicare e utilizzare i risultati degli stessi per migliorare ed efficientare i processi. 

I/Le nostri/e Data Scientist verranno introdotti in contesti progettuali dove comprenderanno le esigenze del Cliente, daranno indicazione ai Data Engineer sulla preparazione desiderata dei dati, sceglieranno o costruiranno i migliori mix di modelli più adatti al caso specifico, discuteranno gli output con il cliente e consegneranno il modello per l’ottimizzazione e passaggio in produzione finale ai Data Engineer. 

In contesti più semplificati in cui la componente di Data Engineering è meno elaborata, i nostri Data Scientist procederanno in autonomia anche nella data preparation e nel porting in produzione dei modelli ingegnerizzati. 

Oltre alle progettualità, ai/alle Data Scientist sarà richiesto un contributo attivo per alimentare la Community con attività di ricerca, scouting, concept di nuove soluzioni e business development. 

Sarai tu ad entrare nel nostro team? 

Requisiti Indispensabili: 

Laurea Specialistica in Ingegneria Informatica, Ingegneria Matematica, Informatica, Statistica o discipline affini (STEM); 

Forte approccio quantitativo e brillanti doti analitiche; 

Passione e competenza in ambito data exploration, analisi dati e creazione di modelli: il nostro team disegna e sviluppa sistemi a supporto di decisioni strategiche per il business; 

Competenze statistiche, di Data Mining, Machine Learning; 

Solida conoscenza e comprovata esperienza in programmazione e scripting con Python 

Conoscenza di tematiche di Deep Learning, NLP e analisi dati non strutturati 

Esperienza con strumenti di version control (es. Git); 

Comprensione di tecnologie legate ai Big Data come Hadoop, MapReduce, Spark 

Conoscenza approfondita di database relazionali e di costrutti SQL e SQL Programming; 

Conoscenza di database non relazionali 

Per profili mid-senior, esperienza comprovata di gestione tecnica delle risorse (persone) su progetto 

Indispensabile la conoscenza fluente di italiano e inglese professionali 

Plus: 

Conoscenza dei linguaggi PySpark o Scala 

Esperienza di lavoro su piattaforma Databricks 

Esperienza nello sviluppo di applicazioni di Gen AI 

Conoscenza e l’utilizzo di API Cloud di Intelligenza Artificiale dei principali cloud provider (Google, Microsoft, AWS, IBM) e di altri strumenti di Advanced Analytics di Vendor specializzati 

Conoscenza di tecniche di semi-supervised e self-supervised learning. 

Esperienza con framework di lavoro AGILE (esempio: Scrum, Kanban), soprattutto per profili mid-senior. 

Soft Skills: 

Profili junior 

Standing consulenziale 

Ottime doti relazionali e comunicative 

Orientamento al cliente e al raggiungimento degli obiettivi 

Buona attitudine a lavorare in team 

Precisione e stress tolerance nel rispetto delle scadenze 

Disponibilità per trasferte in Italia e all’estero 

  

Profili mid-senior 

Standing consulenziale 

Spiccate doti comunicative e interpersonali 

Orientamento al cliente e al raggiungimento degli obiettivi 

Adattabilità e flessibilità 

Precisione e stress tolerance nel rispetto delle scadenze 

Ottime capacità di gestione di progettualità complesse 

Capacità di coordinamento di un team 

Disponibilità per trasferte in Italia e all’estero.

  Perchè Bip?

People at the center of our culture

Fiducia e collaborazione, imprenditorialità e coraggio, meritocrazia e sviluppo guidano la crescita delle nostre persone.

Lavorare in BIP è un'esperienza sfidante, in cui il merito paga e l'innovazione avviene attraverso idee coraggiose, collaborazione e un rapporto di fiducia con i nostri clienti. 

Challenge yourself

Avrai la possibilità di metterti alla prova in contesti progettuali diversi in termini di ambito, natura delle attività e stakeholders coinvolti. Vedrai valorizzato il tuo spirito di iniziativa, la tua passione, l’autonomia e la capacità di assumerti responsabilità e metterti in gioco.

Unlocking your potential

Potrai partecipare a + di 300 corsi formativi all’avanguardia per accrescere le tue competenze su tecnologie e temi di business emergenti.

Work-life Integration

Troverai una policy che supporta lo smartworking fino al 100% del proprio tempo e favorisce il work-life integration

Diversity, Equity and Inclusion

Valorizziamo l’unicità e ci impegniamo a garantire che tutte le nostre persone abbiano pari opportunità di dare un contributo ed esprimere al massimo il potenziale nell'ambiente di lavoro

Il nostro approccio alla diversità e all’inclusione si fonda sui principi di etica e integrità e rappresenta il fattore determinante per lo sviluppo di orizzonti, di crescita personale e aziendale, più ampi.

Promuoviamo l’inserimento e l’integrazione lavorativa delle persone appartenenti alle categorie protette – in base a quanto disciplinato dalla legge 68/99 –.

Next Steps

Una volta ricevuto il tuo cv ci prenderemo del tempo per valutarlo attentamente.

Se c’è un match con questa o con altre posizioni aperte all’interno del Gruppo, ti contatteremo per iniziare la nostra conoscenza reciproca.

L’iter di selezione comprende generalmente un colloquio con HR, un colloquio tecnico con un line manager ed un eventuale colloquio con un Partner.

L’ordine e il numero delle interviste potrebbero variare a seconda delle esigenze di recruiting.

In alternativa, saremo felici di conservare il tuo CV nel nostro database per poterlo rivalutare per altre opportunità future.

Se dovessi identificare tu stesso/a ulteriori posizioni di tuo interesse ed in linea con il tuo profilo, aspettiamo la tua candidatura per poterla valutare nuovamente.

Su di Noi

Nati nel 2003, abbiamo raccolto e valorizzato l’esperienza storica della consulenza e abbiamo aggiunto due ingredienti chiave: l’innovazione e la digitalizzazione.

Grazie a questo percorso siamo oggi oltre 5000 professionisti, presenti in 13 Paesi, con oltre 4500 progetti alle spalle e le conoscenze più all’avanguardia nell'ambito della Digital Transformation, Data Science, Cybersecurity, Industry 4.0, IOT e di tutte le Disruptive Technologies che mettiamo a servizio di ogni settore di mercato.

Aiutiamo i nostri clienti a fare la differenza creando qualità su larga scala attraverso una formula che opera su tre leve: Valore, Persone e Tecnologia.

Crediamo nel valore dell’eccellenza, che è la bussola su cui orientiamo il nostro agire, e adottiamo un approccio etico e leale nei confronti di quante e quanti scelgono di lavorare con noi, promuovendo un ambiente in cui le persone possano crescere insieme, grazie alla contaminazione tra competenze diverse.

People at the center of our culture

Fiducia e collaborazione, imprenditorialità e coraggio, meritocrazia e sviluppo guidano la crescita delle nostre persone.

Lavorare in BIP è un'esperienza sfidante, in cui il merito paga e l'innovazione avviene attraverso idee coraggiose, collaborazione e un rapporto di fiducia con i nostri clienti. 

Challenge yourself

Avrai la possibilità di metterti alla prova in contesti progettuali diversi in termini di ambito, natura delle attività e stakeholders coinvolti. Vedrai valorizzato il tuo spirito di iniziativa, la tua passione, l’autonomia e la capacità di assumerti responsabilità e metterti in gioco.

Unlocking your potential

Potrai partecipare a + di 300 corsi formativi all’avanguardia per accrescere le tue competenze su tecnologie e temi di business emergenti.

Work-life Integration

Troverai una policy che supporta lo smartworking fino al 100% del proprio tempo e favorisce il work-life integration

Diversity, Equity and Inclusion

Valorizziamo l’unicità e ci impegniamo a garantire che tutte le nostre persone abbiano pari opportunità di dare un contributo ed esprimere al massimo il potenziale nell'ambiente di lavoro

Il nostro approccio alla diversità e all’inclusione si fonda sui principi di etica e integrità e rappresenta il fattore determinante per lo sviluppo di orizzonti, di crescita personale e aziendale, più ampi.

Promuoviamo l’inserimento e l’integrazione lavorativa delle persone appartenenti alle categorie protette – in base a quanto disciplinato dalla legge 68/99 –.

Next Steps

Una volta ricevuto il tuo cv ci prenderemo del tempo per valutarlo attentamente.

Se c’è un match con questa o con altre posizioni aperte all’interno del Gruppo, ti contatteremo per iniziare la nostra conoscenza reciproca.

L’iter di selezione comprende generalmente un colloquio con HR, un colloquio tecnico con un line manager ed un eventuale colloquio con un Partner.

L’ordine e il numero delle interviste potrebbero variare a seconda delle esigenze di recruiting.

In alternativa, saremo felici di conservare il tuo CV nel nostro database per poterlo rivalutare per altre opportunità future.

Se dovessi identificare tu stesso/a ulteriori posizioni di tuo interesse ed in linea con il tuo profilo, aspettiamo la tua candidatura per poterla valutare nuovamente.

Su di Noi

Nati nel 2003, abbiamo raccolto e valorizzato l’esperienza storica della consulenza e abbiamo aggiunto due ingredienti chiave: l’innovazione e la digitalizzazione.

Grazie a questo percorso siamo oggi oltre 5000 professionisti, presenti in 13 Paesi, con oltre 4500 progetti alle spalle e le conoscenze più all’avanguardia nell'ambito della Digital Transformation, Data Science, Cybersecurity, Industry 4.0, IOT e di tutte le Disruptive Technologies che mettiamo a servizio di ogni settore di mercato.

Aiutiamo i nostri clienti a fare la differenza creando qualità su larga scala attraverso una formula che opera su tre leve: Valore, Persone e Tecnologia.

Crediamo nel valore dell’eccellenza, che è la bussola su cui orientiamo il nostro agire, e adottiamo un approccio etico e leale nei confronti di quante e quanti scelgono di lavorare con noi, promuovendo un ambiente in cui le persone possano crescere insieme, grazie alla contaminazione tra competenze diverse.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Job Title: Data Scientist

Languages Required: Fluent in English and French

Salary: 80,000

Extra-legal Benefits: Health insurance

Contract Type: Permanent, Full-time

Expected Start Date: October 25, 2024

Job Open Since: October 21, 2024

Work Location: Hybrid (2 days a week in-office at Brussels, Belgium)

Travel Abroad: No

Open to EU Candidates from outside the job's location: Yes

Open to Non-EU Candidates: No

Job Description

We are seeking an experienced Data Scientist to work on advanced predictive modeling and data analysis projects. The role will focus on solution development, data integration, and analytics optimization while ensuring compliance with technical standards. If you have a passion for data science and are ready to make an impact in the transportation industry, this is a great opportunity to contribute to critical projects in a hybrid work environment.

Key Responsibilities


Advanced Predictive Modeling & Data Analysis: Develop and implement advanced predictive models and perform complex data analysis to meet business and technical requirements. Maintain data-driven features and ensure proper documentation of developed solutions.
Solution Development & Implementation: Collaborate with cross-functional teams to translate business requirements into actionable data science solutions. Develop and optimize data pipelines and ETL processes to support data integration and analytics.
Compliance & Best Practices: Ensure that all data science activities adhere to established technical and architectural guidelines. Maintain proper documentation of all developed models and solutions.
Collaboration & Teamwork: Work within a team of 15 members in the Data & Analytics department. Communicate effectively across technical and non-technical stakeholders, ensuring clear reporting and delivering insights.



Skills & Qualifications


General Skills: Experience in the transportation sector is highly desirable. Strong problem-solving abilities, customer-focused mindset, and excellent communication skills. Ability to work in a virtual team environment.
Technical Skills:
Proven experience in data science, with expertise in statistical techniques and machine learning models.
Proficiency in Python or R for data analysis.
Experience with big data platforms such as Hadoop or Spark, and familiarity with cloud environments like AWS or Microsoft Azure.
Knowledge of technologies such as Scala, Angular, Python libraries (Pandas, Flask, Torchvision), Azure SQL, Azure Blob Storage, Linux (Ubuntu), Onnx, Pytorch, and Docker.
Experience in data engineering and developing data pipelines or ETL processes.
Expertise in predictive algorithms and analytics, particularly in the transportation industry.
Proficiency in data visualization using tools such as Power BI or similar platforms.

Certifications: Certifications in data science and Agile/Scrum methodologies are advantageous.
Behavioral Skills:
Self-motivated and able to take initiative.
Strong teamwork skills, able to collaborate with internal teams and external consultants.
Experience in project management and leadership is a plus.
Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously.



Required Skills


Python: Expert
Pytorch: Expert
Scala: Expert
Azure Blob Storage: Advanced
Azure SQL Server: Expert
Docker: Expert
Linux: Advanced
Onnx: Advanced
Angular: Advanced
Hadoop/Spark: Intermediate
Power BI: Advanced



Additional Skills (Nice To Have)


Experience with public transport data is a plus.
Knowledge of DevOps practices and MLOps for managing data pipelines and models.
Familiarity with API integration and system interoperability.



Soft Skills


Curiosity and creativity: Key in exploring new ideas and staying up-to-date with industry trends.
Problem-solving: Analytical thinking to troubleshoot issues and develop data-driven solutions.
Autonomy: Ability to take initiative and work with minimal supervision.
Collaboration: Strong interpersonal skills to work with technical and non-technical teams.

Show more

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Description:
RAND is a not-for-profit research institute with over 30 years of experience in conducting policy research for governments, international organisations, research councils, charitable foundations, and other organisations. We believe that good research helps shape sound answers to pressing societal challenges, ultimately making communities safer and more secure, healthier and more prosperous in the future. RAND Europe has offices in Cambridge, Brussels and Rotterdam and employs approximately 170 staff.

The research groups in RAND Europe boast a diverse portfolio, addressing key public policy challenges such as education and child welfare, health and wellbeing, geopolitical competition and national security, environment and climate change, technological innovation and disruption, among many others. Our team, comprising individuals from various nationalities and professional backgrounds, is dedicated to advancing innovative approaches to address pressing societal issues.

We are now seeking a Data Scientist to enhance our cross-research group data science capabilities. The successful candidate will play a pivotal role in delivering tools to support our research which shaping public policy research, influencing high-level government decision-making in the UK, the European Union, and globally. This role offers the chance to engage in intellectually stimulating work within a dynamic and diverse team, tackling a broad spectrum of topics, and employing cutting-edge methods, including AI/ML.

We welcome applications from a range of experience levels, from those slightly below to those exceeding our criteria.

Responsibilities


Spearhead project delivery and research tool development within the research group portfolios, emphasising the integration of data-driven evidence
Coordinate complex projects, mentor a team of talented data scientists and researchers, and drive the impact of our work through strategic communication and outreach
Utilise a broad spectrum of data science skills and remain committed to continuous learning and methodological innovation
Lead and support impactful R&D, mentor staff, and expand our research scope
Drive business development, manage proposals, and cultivate funding relationships
Collaborate with the leadership teams to shape research strategy and contribute to RAND Europe's broader objectives



Requirements

Essential


Expertise in data science and quantitative methods (e.g., statistical analysis, machine learning, causal inference, simulation modelling, network analysis, econometrics, natural language processing, use of large language models etc.)
Strong project management skills, including budgeting and team leadership
Exceptional analytical, writing, and presentation abilities, with a knack for conveying complex concepts to diverse audiences
A track record of collaborative research and team motivation, with a focus on skills and career development
Higher Degree in a quantitative research discipline
Ability to explain quantitative research to non-specialists and integrate it into mixed-methods projects including non-technical team members
Proven project delivery within time and budget constraints
Interest in public policy areas and collaborative research delivery



Desirable


Additional technical skills (e.g., general coding skills, data mining, dashboard and tool development, data management, data visualisation etc.)
Experience applying data science methods and tools to support policy research and/or social sciences research
Eligibility for UK Security Clearance (SC) or Developed Vetting (DV)



Personal Qualities:


Strategic and analytical thinker with a practical perspective
Networking and presentation skills to foster relationships and secure funding
Team-oriented with a commitment to rigorous research and public service
Eagerness to learn, contribute to team development, and embrace new challenges


This role is based in our Cambridge office however we offer a hybrid working model asking staff to attend the office a minimum of once a week. There is occasional travel, primarily to London and Brussels.

(We can also consider offering this role based out of our Brussels or Netherlands office.)

Benefits

Please see our careers page for associate benefits for each location

How To Apply

If you believe you are suited to the above role, please submit an application comprising of a CV and covering letter. Closing date for applications is Sunday 10th November 2024

If you have not been contacted within 30 days of application deadline, please assume your application has not been successful.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Permanent position only




WHAT IS CREAM ALL ABOUT?

We could be a Cream Factory, a cooking blog or even a detective agency…but in reality, we are a consulting company in Business & Technology active in large organizations and industry leaders in Banking, Insurance, Telecom, Energy, Pharmaceutical & Transport.




CREAM’S SPECIAL RECIPE:

1/3 of Personal development
1/3 of Collective Intelligence
1/3 of Intrapreneurship

Bonus ingredient: … Some passionate colleagues 😀




WHAT IS A DATA SCIENTIST AT CREAM?

As Robin, Data Scientist, you will have a key role in the implementation of innovative data models to solve specific business issues. You will be part of a challenging and multidisciplinary team. You will discover various industries.




YOUR TASKS:

You gather business requirements to better understand your client’s needs
You dive in a large amount of data to discover is hidden
You provide data-driven recommendations to the client
Based on your client’s needs, you apply predictive analysis and machine learning
You bring out concrete and predictive models
At the end, you help the business to better optimize the use of their data
data




HOW DO WE IMAGINE OUR FUTURE CONSULTANT?

You have at least 2 years of experience in Data Science
You want to learn more about Machine Learning, Robotics Process Automation (RPA)…
You are used to work with one of the following technologies : MATLAB, R, SAS, Python, Java …
You have good communication and synthesis skills
You are fluent in French and English; a good knowledge of Dutch is an asset




WHY SHOULD YOU TASTE CREAM/THE LIME FLAVOUR?

A broad diversity of career options: you’re not stuck in a box
You evolve in a learning environment where you can challenge your knowledge with your colleagues
You grow in a company that is at the leading edge of technology
You have the opportunity to bring new ideas to develop a thriving company
We have values we share, live with, experiment every day

We just hire great people and give them the playing field to become awesome!




"THE LITTLE THING THAT CAN MAKE THE DIFFERENCE,

CREAM IS DEVELOPING A DIVERSITY PLAN AND WOULD LIKE THAT ALL ITS MEMBERS REFLECT THE SOCIETY IN ALL ITS DIVERSITY"

Title: AI Engineer
Description:
🚀 We're Hiring: AI Engineer🚀




Location: Fully Remote (EU) | Occasional Travel (Once Every 2 Months)




Are you passionate about artificial intelligence and looking for a fully remote opportunity within Europe? Our client, a cutting-edge tech company, is seeking an experienced AI Engineer to join their growing team!




What You’ll Do:




Design, develop, and deploy advanced AI models and solutions.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate AI into various applications.
Stay up-to-date with the latest advancements in AI and machine learning.
Occasionally travel across Europe (once every two months) to meet the team and stakeholders.




Requirements:




✅ Proven experience in AI engineering, machine learning, and deep learning.

✅ Proficiency in Python, TensorFlow, and other AI tools.

✅ Strong problem-solving skills and ability to handle complex data.

✅ Must be based in the EU, with the ability to travel occasionally.




Why You’ll Love This Role:




🌟 Fully remote role with flexible working hours.

🌟 Join a dynamic team at the forefront of AI technology.

🌟 Competitive salary and great perks.

🌟 Opportunity to work on innovative projects and make a real impact

🌟 Up to 90,000 EUR Salary + Many additional Perks




Ready to take the next step in your AI career? Apply now.

Title: Data Scientist
HTML:
А global digital transformation company with a team of more than 4,900 global players in 26 countries – in Europe, America and Asia, working together to put organizations at the forefront of innovation by bringing together talent, knowledge and technology.

Our approach is based on conscious technology, through which we create positive environments and meaningful opportunities, always in our own way, making the complex simple.


VASS BeNeLux, in partnership with the European Commission, is currently seeking an Expert Data Scientist to work from the European Commission.



The role:

  • Collect business requirement and develop advanced data mining solutions or identify, assess and deploy relevant existing data mining, machine learning and business intelligence solutions;
  • Specification and design of presentation interfaces with optimal usability/user experience;
  • Identify, collect, convert and update different data types/sets in several locations (e.g. ETL);
  • Produces data models according to specific problems statements;
  • Scripting and programming;
  • Contribute to the design and implementation of the analytics architecture and its solution stack (including performance aspects, physical design, capacity dimensions etc…);
  • Write the different documentation associated with the tasks and liaise with other project teams as necessary to address cross-project interdependencies.



You have:

  • Excellent knowledge of Data Analytics techniques and tools;
  • Experience with languages like R, Python, PERL;
  • Proficient in continuous code delivery and unit testing;
  • Expertise in the ETL processes and tools (i.e. Talend Open Studio…);
  • Good knowledge of SQL tooling (NoSQL DB, MongoDB, Hadoop, SQL);
  • Knowledge of architectural design and implementation of scalable modern data stores;
  • Knowledge of R-Studio infrastructure is an asset;
  • Experience in developing interactive R / Python dashboards using packages like Shiny, Dash or similar is an asset;
  • Experience in developing R / Python functions to perform linear algebra calculations with data frames and arrays, ensuring efficient manipulation of data is an asset;
  • Experience in using the following libraries (or equivalents) is an asset:
  • Data Management: Pandas (tidyverse and dplyr for R), Numpy;
  • Data Visualizations: at least one among Matplotlib, Seaborn or Plotly (ggplot2 for R);
  • Capability to write clear and structured technical documents;
  • Ability to work in a team as well as autonomously;
  • Results-oriented mindset, focused on delivering;
  • communication skills in English, both orally and in written form.



If you want to join a dynamic company where technological challenges will be found in your day to day we are waiting for you in the great VASS team.

And we encourage you to be the best version of yourself: Transformative, Creative, Honest, Vibrant!


At VASS we take action every day to achieve a favourable environment that facilitates and promotes equal opportunities, non-discrimination, diversity and inclusion of all people. We select our talent based on business needs, skills and merits. 🌟

Title: Applied ML Engineer
Description:
Join an AI-powered platform transforming how creators, filmmakers, and animators craft videos with precise control.




Position: Applied ML Engineer

Location: Remote

Salary: upto €130,000




Key Responsibilities:

Develop and maintain ML pipelines aligned with our product roadmap.
Deploy and optimize GenAI models like Stable Diffusion and GANs.
Collaborate with design and engineering teams to solve unique challenges.
Build scalable, cost-effective APIs for cloud-based models.




Requirements:

Experience with large-scale ML systems and Python/PyTorch.
Expertise in computer vision, machine learning, and AI.
Bachelor’s in Computer Science or equivalent experience.




Take the next step towards an exciting career by clicking the "Apply" button. We look forward to hearing from you!

Title: AI Engineer
Description:
Join an innovative growing AI company at the cutting edge of conversational AI! In just six months, we've attracted 7 million users to our groundbreaking platform, which enhances AI-powered experiences

We cater to enthusiasts seeking authentic virtual companionship, providing an AI-powered conversational platform that breaks the boundaries of imagination

Why Join Us?


Pioneering Work: Join an ambitious project at the forefront of AI development, where you can help shape the future of AI-powered experiences.
Exciting Tech Stack: Work with a cutting-edge stack, including Ruby on Rails, PostgreSQL, Python, PyTorch, and Stable Diffusion.
Proven Leadership: Our founders have a history of transforming projects from inception to monumental success, including multiple exits and a successful IPO.
Impressive Traction: Since our launch in September 2023, we've attracted over 7 million active users, demonstrating our product's wide appeal.
Global Presence: Be part of an international, fully distributed team based in Paris, NYC, Sydney, Dubai, and Mumbai, promoting diversity and flexibility.
Benefits & Compensation: Work From Anywhere: Enjoy the flexibility of our fully remote setup, allowing you to work from your preferred location and maintain a healthy work-life balance.
Global Gatherings: Participate in annual meetups and team-building events to strengthen connections and foster camaraderie.


Reporting directly to our CTO

Key Responsibilities


Interact with stakeholders (Co-founders, Web Engineers, DevOps Engineers) to bring your project to life.
Improve our AI moderation systems to identify and filter inappropriate content, including implementing classifiers for detecting sensitive topics.
Oversee the creation and optimization of algorithms for LLM behavior adjustments based on user interactions, focusing on fine-tuning and prompt engineering.
Develop strategies for multi-AI interactions within group chats, ensuring robust and scalable solutions.
Adaptation and fine-tuning of base models for multilingual support
Manage the creation and maintenance of diverse datasets critical for training and improving the performance of LLMs.
Assess and decide on the best technological approaches, choosing between classifiers, fine- tuning, and other methods based on specific project needs.


Your Qualifications

Hard Skills


5+ years experience in machine learning, neural networks, and dataset management.
Advanced degree in Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, or related fields.
Proven experience in AI projects, particularly in NLP and LLMs.
Ability to work with cross-functional teams to translate complex requirements into actionable plans.
Proficient in programming languages relevant to AI development, such as Python, Pytorch, and familiarity with AI development tools and frameworks.


Soft Skills


Strong communication & collaborative skills (perfectly fluent in English)
Ownership and commitment - we’re looking for owners, not renters
Doer mindset - we are moving fast and we need people that can find the right balance between software craftsmanship and velocity
User-centricity - you are proud of what you build and you share our obsession for amazing user experience
#NSFW - you are comfortable building products that are based on uncensored models and content (free speech, erotic roleplay, etc.)
Location: you must be located or willing to work in a time zone { CET +/- 3 hours } as majority of members of our technical team live in Europe. Bonus points
Proven track record of open-source contributions (Hugging Face or Github repos)
In-depth experience with our current data science stack : LlaMa2/3 (chatbot), Stable Diffusion (text-to-image), Eleven Labs (text-to-voice)
Experience in AI video generation


Join Our Adventure

If you're passionate about advancing the boundaries of AI and excited to join a team that values innovation, creativity, and a pioneering spirit, we want to hear from you. At our company, your work will impact millions, shaping the future of digital companionship and interactive experiences. Let's create, innovate, and grow together. Dive into the future of conversational AI with us.
Show more
HTML:
Join an innovative growing AI company at the cutting edge of conversational AI! In just six months, we've attracted 7 million users to our groundbreaking platform, which enhances AI-powered experiences

We cater to enthusiasts seeking authentic virtual companionship, providing an AI-powered conversational platform that breaks the boundaries of imagination

Why Join Us?

  • Pioneering Work: Join an ambitious project at the forefront of AI development, where you can help shape the future of AI-powered experiences.
  • Exciting Tech Stack: Work with a cutting-edge stack, including Ruby on Rails, PostgreSQL, Python, PyTorch, and Stable Diffusion.
  • Proven Leadership: Our founders have a history of transforming projects from inception to monumental success, including multiple exits and a successful IPO.
  • Impressive Traction: Since our launch in September 2023, we've attracted over 7 million active users, demonstrating our product's wide appeal.
  • Global Presence: Be part of an international, fully distributed team based in Paris, NYC, Sydney, Dubai, and Mumbai, promoting diversity and flexibility.
  • Benefits & Compensation: Work From Anywhere: Enjoy the flexibility of our fully remote setup, allowing you to work from your preferred location and maintain a healthy work-life balance.
  • Global Gatherings: Participate in annual meetups and team-building events to strengthen connections and foster camaraderie.

Reporting directly to our CTO

Key Responsibilities

  • Interact with stakeholders (Co-founders, Web Engineers, DevOps Engineers) to bring your project to life.
  • Improve our AI moderation systems to identify and filter inappropriate content, including implementing classifiers for detecting sensitive topics.
  • Oversee the creation and optimization of algorithms for LLM behavior adjustments based on user interactions, focusing on fine-tuning and prompt engineering.
  • Develop strategies for multi-AI interactions within group chats, ensuring robust and scalable solutions.
  • Adaptation and fine-tuning of base models for multilingual support
  • Manage the creation and maintenance of diverse datasets critical for training and improving the performance of LLMs.
  • Assess and decide on the best technological approaches, choosing between classifiers, fine- tuning, and other methods based on specific project needs.

Your Qualifications

Hard Skills

  • 5+ years experience in machine learning, neural networks, and dataset management.
  • Advanced degree in Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, or related fields.
  • Proven experience in AI projects, particularly in NLP and LLMs.

  • In-depth experience with our current data science stack : LlaMa2/3 (chatbot), Stable Diffusion (text-to-image), Eleven Labs (text-to-voice)
  • Experience in AI video generation

Join Our Adventure

If you're passionate about advancing the boundaries of AI and excited to join a team that values innovation, creativity, and a pioneering spirit, we want to hear from you. At our company, your work will impact millions, shaping the future of digital companionship and interactive experiences. Let's create, innovate, and grow together. Dive into the future of conversational AI with us.

Title: Data Scientist - Signal Processing
Description:
Data Scientist (Signal Processing Specialist)

Our client, a leader in autonomous systems, is seeking a Data Scientist with a specialization in Signal Processing to join their innovative team. This is a unique opportunity to work on high-impact projects at the intersection of AI, data science, and state-of-the-art technology, transforming sensor data into actionable insights for complex, real-world applications.



What You Will Be Doing



In this role, you will:

Develop sophisticated algorithms to analyze radar and sensor data, enabling detection, segmentation, and tracking.
Conduct detailed data analysis to reveal meaningful insights and patterns.
Build and optimize machine learning models to maximize performance and accuracy.
Prepare data through filtering, denoising, and normalization, making it suitable for advanced modeling and analysis.
Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams, including engineers, developers, and product managers, to translate project requirements into scalable, efficient solutions.
Deploy models to production, ensuring their robustness and scalability.
Document your work to support reproducibility and ongoing improvements.


Profile & Requirements



Education:

Bachelor's degree (minimum) in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Data Science, or a related field; an advanced degree (Master's or Ph.D.) is a plus.

Experience:

3+ years in a commercial data science role, particularly in signal processing for sensor data, radar, SAR, or maritime radar systems.

Technical Skills:

Proficiency in Python and familiarity with MATLAB and C++.
Strong knowledge of signal processing techniques and machine learning frameworks like TensorFlow, PyTorch, TensorRT, or scikit-learn.
Experience with Jupyter Notebooks for experimentation and model development.
Knowledge of radar systems and signal processing specific to radar and SAR data.
Familiarity with cloud platforms (GCP preferred, AWS or Azure acceptable) and experience with taking ML models into production.
Understanding of DevOps practices, including GIT, CI/CD, and telemetry tools.

Soft Skills:

Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Team-oriented with a proactive, adaptable approach to dynamic environments.


Darwin Recruitment is acting as an Employment Agency in relation to this vacancy.

Show more

Title: Expert in AI/ NLP/ ML
Description:
Brayton Global is currently looking for an Expert in AI/NLP/ML to work for a prestigious client based in Brussels (remote work from Belgium)




DESCRIPTION OF THE TASKS

The tasks performed by external service provider will cover the whole development cycle of AI and data architectures and solutions from end-to-end, including:

Key tasks:

Design and Development:

o Architect, design, and implement advanced machine learning models, including but not limited to deep learning, reinforcement learning, and large language models (LLMs).

o Develop scalable AI solutions using state-of-the-art techniques and frameworks.

o Collaborate with data scientists to refine data preprocessing, feature engineering, and model training pipelines.

Deployment and Integration:

o Deploy machine learning models and AI solutions into production environments, ensuring scalability, performance, and reliability.

o Integrate AI models with existing systems and workflows, providing seamless functionality across platforms.

o Optimize models for performance, including latency, throughput, and accuracy, considering both cloud and edge deployment scenarios.

Research and Innovation:

o Stay up-to-date with the latest advancements in AI, ML, and LLM technologies, and apply them to enhance our AI capabilities.

o Experiment with new algorithms, architectures, and techniques to push the boundaries of AI within the organization.

o Contribute to research publications, patents, and open-source projects as appropriate.

Collaboration and Communication:

o Work closely with cross-functional teams to understand business requirements and translate them into technical solutions.

o Communicate complex AI concepts and technical details to non-technical stakeholders effectively.

o Mentor junior engineers and provide guidance on best practices in AI and ML development.

Testing and Evaluation:

o Conduct rigorous testing and validation of AI models, including A/B testing, cross validation, and error analysis.

o Monitor model performance in production and iterate on models to improve accuracy and robustness.

o Implement monitoring systems to detect model drift and ensure continued performance




LEVEL OF EDUCATION

a master degree of 5 years. Master’s degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Artificial Intelligence, or a related field. PhD is a plus.




KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS

Proven experience in designing, implementing, and deploying advanced machine learning models and AI systems.
Strong experience with large language models (LLMs) and natural language processing (NLP) techniques.
Experience with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure).

Technical Skills:

Deep understanding of machine learning frameworks and libraries.
Experience with data processing and ETL tools.
Familiarity with MLOps practices and tools.




Kindly note that we require European citizenships for this position because we are NOT able to provide sponsorships.

Title: AI/ML Engineer
Description:
Our client’s European team is looking to hire experienced AI/ML Engineers to spearhead the development of cutting-edge biomedical AI algorithms. This position will focus on researching, designing, and implementing advanced predictive models to tackle a variety of complex biomedical challenges, leveraging the client’s state-of-the-art high-performance computing resources and rich biomedical data.




Responsibilities

Investigate and build advanced machine learning models, including deep learning techniques, to improve performance on diverse biomedical prediction tasks.
Create and deploy AI/ML solutions across the full model development lifecycle.
Deliver reliable, thoroughly tested, and high-performance code within an agile framework.
Work closely with specialists in biology, medicine, and experimental design to ensure effective data collection for training biomedical machine learning models.




Qualifications

Advanced degree in computer science, bioinformatics, or a similar degree.
OR extensive experience implementing state-of-the-art AI/ML solutions.
Experience in PyTorch or TensorFlow AND advanced experience in Python.
Experience in software engineering and machine learning best practices, including version control, continuous integration (CI) and continuous development (CD), and shell scripting.




Desired

Background in biology, molecular biology, or a similar field.
Fluency in English and German.
Experience in the creation and implementation of commercial AI/ML software.
Experience working with biomedical data (e.g., genomics, transcriptomics, proteomics, electronic health records, clinical images).




Apply with your CV and/or reach out to Damian at for more information.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
About us




NTT DATA – a part of NTT Group - is a Top 10 global IT services provider, headquartered in Tokyo, with over 150,000 employees.




We deliver consulting solutions by combining specialized sectorial knowledge, our transformation management skills, and our large technology expertise (data, RPA, AI, low code, cloud, IoT, virtual reality), to keep our clients, as well as society, a step ahead in this digitally dynamic world.




Everything we do is underpinned by our core values of 'Teamwork', 'Foresight' and 'Clients First'. Our shared leadership principles of Collaboration, Engagement and Curiosity help us build a community where our people are equipped with the best resources to face new challenges.




We are looking for a Data Scientist to join our Data & Analytics team in Brussels.




Please only apply if you have a fluent level in French or Dutch.




Your role:

Data Analysis and Modeling. Utilize statistical methods and machine learning algorithms to analyze complex data sets, build predictive models, and derive actionable insights.
Data Visualization and Communication. Create clear and compelling data visualizations and reports to effectively communicate findings and recommendations to stakeholders.
Collaboration and Strategy Development. Work with cross-functional teams to integrate data science solutions into business strategies, providing expertise on data-driven decision-making and innovation.




Your profile:

Experience in Data Analysis and Modeling: Over 4 years of experience in analyzing data, building statistical models, and developing machine learning algorithms.
Proficiency in Programming Languages: Strong programming skills in Python or R, with practical experience in relevant libraries and frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-Learn).
Knowledge of Advanced Analytical Techniques: Experience with advanced analytical techniques such as deep learning or natural language processing (NLP).
Background in Big Data Technologies: Experience with big data technologies and cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP) for data processing and analysis.




Nice to have:

Certification in Data Science or Machine Learning: Relevant certifications in data science, machine learning, or related fields.
Experience with Cloud Data Platforms: Familiarity with cloud-based data platforms and services.
Expertise in Data Visualization: Experience with data visualization tools and techniques to effectively communicate insights (e.g., Tableau, Power BI, Matplotlib, Seaborn).
Experience in Agile Environments: Familiarity with agile methodologies and experience working in agile teams.




Why NTT DATA ?

🤝 We value a collaborative and supportive environment, celebrating curiosity and engagement

🚀Career development. Training path and access to learning opportunities such, yearly performance reviews and a mentorship program

💻 We believe in work-life balance and flexibility. Wear casual clothing, decide your working hours and enjoy our hybrid working model

✨ We are a certified ‘Top Employer’ in Belgium and Europe.

🌿 Health & well-being. Focus on your mental health with access to a platform with certified psychologists & mental health workshops. Take a break with one of our online fitness and well-being sessions

🌈 Diversity & inclusion. We are committed to equal employment opportunities regardless of gender, gender expression and identity, sexual orientation, religion, culture, origin, disability, age, or other personal and social characteristics. #WeAreAllUnique #YouMakeUsUnique

🗣 Internal Referral program Talent Friends. Refer a friend and receive a bonus when they join.




On top of this, your benefits will include:

Company car + fuel card or flexible Mobility Budget

Bike to work reimbursement scheme

Medical insurance for you and your family

Life insurance

Certification bonus scheme

Representation allowance

Access to OpenUp wellbeing service

Language courses

Udemy account

Discount in online shops

Teleworking equipment allowance

Meal vouchers

Eco vouchers

Internet allowance

13th month + holiday allowance

32 days paid annual leave




Upon receiving an interview, you may request accommodation for any accessibility needs.

Sounds interesting? Apply now or share it with a friend 🔹

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Als ervaren data scientist puur je relevante inzichten uit de grote hoeveelheid data waarover Colruyt Group beschikt. Je maakt statistische modellen en geeft strategisch advies aan onze verschillende retailmerken. Het resultaat van jouw werk: een nog betere dienstverlening op maat van onze klanten.




Wat doe je concreet?




In de divisie Data & Analytics werk je in multidisciplinair team bestaand uit data science engineers, bi engineers, business analysts, … Samen bieden jullie analytische oplossingen aan voor de verschillende Colruyt Group merken, zoals Colruyt, Okay, Bike-Republic of Jims. In het data science kennisgroep worden ervaringen en kennis uitgewisseld. Op deze manier blijf je bijleren.
Als data scientist werk je samen met complementaire collega’s aan een brede waaier van projecten waarbij je in aanraking komt met nieuwe technieken en technologieën. We moedigen je ook aan om zelf, in overleg met het team, op zoek te gaan naar nieuwe methoden en technieken en zo de kennis en skills van de groep te vergroten. Naast een heel ruim aanbod aan interne opleidingen krijg je ook de kans om aanvullende opleidingstrajecten te volgen. Op die manier bouw je continu aan je business-kennis, je technische skills en je sociale vaardigheden.
Met het team focussen we enerzijds op onze interne klanten, de business-partners. We vertalen hun vragen in analytische projecten die we aanpakken in multidisciplinaire teams. Dat resulteert in een directe en nauwe samenwerking met ETL, software development en de businesspartner.
Anderzijds zijn we ook verantwoordelijk voor de identificatie van nieuwe analytics-opportuniteiten. We gaan proactief op zoek naar nieuwe inzichten die een toegevoegde waarde creëren voor onze partners. Daarbij kijken we uiteraard niet alleen naar Colruyt Group, maar volgen we ook de externe trends op het vlak van use cases rond analytics en technologische innovatie.
Colruyt Group bestaat uit veel verschillende entiteiten. Dat zorgt voor een enorme variatie en hoeveelheid aan data én use cases. De projecten waar je aan meewerkt gaan dan ook van klantensegmentatie over verkoopsprognose en analyse van winkeltesten tot operationele efficiëntie van machines, predictive maintenance en optimaal gebruik van grondstoffen.




Je werkt in Halle en kan tot drie dagen per week thuiswerken.




Profiel




Opleiding en ervaring – Je hebt een solide basis in handels- en of computerwetenschappen, statistiek, wiskunde of ingenieursstudies. Je hebt minstens 3 tot 5 jaar relevante ervaring.
ennis statistische modellering – Je hebt een uitstekende kennis van statistische modellering en kan deze implementeren in Python. Je hebt kennis van SQL en datavisualisatie-technieken.
Analytisch vermogen – Je slaagt erin om data te vertalen naar inzichten en je kan die ook helder en duidelijk communiceren.
Talenkennis – Kennis van het Nederlands is een must. Je praat zeer vlot Engels. Kennis van het Frans is een plus.




Wij bieden




Stimulerende werkomgeving – Je belandt in een ongelooflijk boeiende en rijke data-omgeving, krijgt ruimte voor initiatief en krijgt een brede kijk op het bedrijf.
Permanente leermogelijkheden – Je leert dagelijks bij en krijgt ook de kans om jouw talenten te ontwikkelen via interne en externe opleidingen. Op termijn zijn er ook reële doorgroeikansen.
Aantrekkelijk loonpakket – Je krijgt een competitief loon met tal van extralegale voordelen zoals een bedrijfswagen, winstdeelname en maaltijdcheques.

Show more

Je werkt in Halle en kan tot drie dagen per week thuiswerken.


Profiel


  • Opleiding en ervaring – Je hebt een solide basis in handels- en of computerwetenschappen, statistiek, wiskunde of ingenieursstudies. Je hebt minstens 3 tot 5 jaar relevante ervaring.
  • ennis statistische modellering – Je hebt een uitstekende kennis van statistische modellering en kan deze implementeren in Python. Je hebt kennis van SQL en datavisualisatie-technieken.
  • Analytisch vermogen – Je slaagt erin om data te vertalen naar inzichten en je kan die ook helder en duidelijk communiceren.
  • Talenkennis – Kennis van het Nederlands is een must. Je praat zeer vlot Engels. Kennis van het Frans is een plus.


Wij bieden


  • Stimulerende werkomgeving – Je belandt in een ongelooflijk boeiende en rijke data-omgeving, krijgt ruimte voor initiatief en krijgt een brede kijk op het bedrijf.
  • Permanente leermogelijkheden – Je leert dagelijks bij en krijgt ook de kans om jouw talenten te ontwikkelen via interne en externe opleidingen. Op termijn zijn er ook reële doorgroeikansen.
  • Aantrekkelijk loonpakket – Je krijgt een competitief loon met tal van extralegale voordelen zoals een bedrijfswagen, winstdeelname en maaltijdcheques.

Title: (Gen) AI and Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
As Stephen Few states: “We are overwhelmed by information, not because there is too much, but because we haven't learned how to tame it.” Capgemini Insights & Data is looking for people who tame data in such a way that the most complex data can be easily interpreted.




We are looking for a (GEN) AI and Machine Learning Engineer to help our clients in their digital transformations.




Key tasks & activities

Use ML and Generative AI tools and other technologies to design, evangelize, and implement state-of-the-art solutions for never-before-solved problems.
Define and implement best practices for building, testing, and deploying scalable AI solutions, with a focus on generative models and LLM.
Drive successful business outcomes for educating, training, designing and building cloud hosted Generative AI solutions
Interact with customers directly to understand the business problem, help and aid them in implementation of their ML ecosystem
Educate customers on the value proposition of GenAI and showcase the art of possible.
Participate in deep architectural discussions and design exercises to create solutions while ensuring solutions are designed for successful deployment in the cloud.
Stay at the forefront of AI technological advancements, especially in Generative AI and LLM, and assess their applicability to our business needs.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including data scientists, AI/ML & data engineers, and functional SMEs, to ensure seamless integration and alignment of AI solutions with business objectives. influence the technical viability of the architecture of AI projects, ensuring optimal performance, scalability, and integration.
Develop Solutions to ensure robust and secure data pipelines and infrastructure to support AI model training and deployment.
Lead the evaluation of new AI tools, frameworks, and methodologies, advocating for the adoption of technologies that align with our strategic goals.




Knowledge & Experience

Experience in leveraging artificial intelligence and machine learning technologies to optimize and transform various aspects of our business operations.
Minimum of 4 years of experience in designing and building AI solutions, with a strong focus on end-to-end automation.
Proven expertise in machine learning techniques, deep learning frameworks, image processing and AI-related technologies including Generative AI.
Experience with one of the cloud platforms, preferably Azure
Experience with Python or PySpark.
Experience in using Data Science Platforms
Experience using the latest Data Science platforms (e.g. Databricks, Dataiku, AzureML, SageMaker ) and frameworks (e.g. Tensorflow, PyTorch, MXNet, scikit-learn )
Good understanding of software architecture patterns & application development.
Familiarity with DevOps,DataOps,MLOps, LLMOps principles including code repository, code management, CI/CD and AI-related automation.
Strong communication skills for both presenting work to clients, disseminating complex information in an easy-to-understand form on a day-to-day basis, and managing stakeholders.
Native speaker in Dutch or French with professional working proficiency in English.




#GetTheFutureYouWant




At Capgemini, we believe in diversity, equal opportunities, and a workplace where everyone feels valued. We take good care of people and help them make progress by assigning challenging projects and providing ample opportunities for personal growth and learning. We are looking for experienced professionals ready for their next career move.

You will join the I&D team, an ambitious, collaborative, supportive environment—problem-solvers with a strong focus on exchanging best practices to deliver exceptional results with Data science. Here, the knowledge of each team member and their own expertise is valuable to enable effective decision-making, proactive planning, and smooth project execution.




In return, we offer an attractive salary with fringe benefits:

A hybrid or electric company car (or mobility budget)
Meal & eco vouchers
Group & health insurance
Flexible work hours & the opportunity to work from home (70% of the time)
32 vacation days & 45 workcation days (to work abroad)
Intensive training and certification at all levels to keep you up to date with the latest trends & technologies




Apply now! We'd love to hear from you.




For more information: contact liz.nzimbula@capgemini.com or visit www.capgemini.com

Show more

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
What can you expect?

Python Predictions is currently looking for an experienced Machine Learning Engineer. In this role, you will need to be able to adapt quickly to new technologies, applications and environments. You will operate with our current clients on a medium to long-term basis.

As an ML Engineer, you will help our clients building and serving machine learning models. More specifically, the responsibilities include:

Design and implement solutions to serve machine learning models, from traditional ML to Generative AI.
Train, improve, and deploy ML models.
Write production ready code and serve online, batch, and real time models
Identify, design, and implement process improvements in the machine learning lifecylce: automating manual processes, optimizing data delivery, re-design infrastructure for greater scalability, etc
Collaborate with Data Scientists, MLOps Engineers and Data Engineers, to integrate all parts of the solution.
Coach colleagues and clients in your area of expertise







Who are we looking for?

Required

Master or PhD in Machine Learning, Artificial Intelligence, Computer Engineering, or related field.
At least 3 years of experience as a Machine Learning Engineer, Data Scientist, MLOps Engineer, or in a similar position.
Strong software engineering background
Experience deploying machine learning in production
Experience with experiment tracking, models monitoring, and deployment strategies
Ability to write production ready code in Python.
Experience with CI/CD pipelines and understanding of Infrastructure as Code
Knowledge of containers and container orchestration.
Master software engineering best practices and software release cycle.
Solid understanding of Linux and in depth knowledge of at least one cloud provider.
Knowledge of big data technologies such as Apache Spark, Kafka.
Able to coach others and give technical advice and direction.Experience building, scheduling and maintaining ML pipelines
Able to work independently, prioritize multiple stakeholders and tasks, and manage work time effectively
Proficient in English, knowledge of Dutch and/or French is a plus







What do we have to offer?

Python Predictions is a Brussels-based service provider specialized in data projects with business impact
In January 2020, Python Predictions joined Tobania – a leading Belgian business & technology consulting. And in turn, in March 2023, Tobania joined Sopra Steria – a major Tech player in Europe recognized for its consulting, digital services and software development
Great variation in job content due to missions in different industries, different domains and different environments
In-company training adapted to your personal needs
Continuous learning in monthly team meetings and personal development time
A great team of colleagues with shared values

Discover our Tobania galaxy

Show more

Title: AI/NLP/ML Expert
HTML:
We currently have a vacancy for a AI/NLP/ML Expert fluent in English, to offer his/her services as an expert who will be based in Brussels, Belgium. The work will be carried out either in the company's premises or on site at customer premises. In the context of the first assignment, the successful candidate will be integrated in the Development team of the company that will closely cooperate with a major client's IT team on site.

Your tasks

  • Integration and maintenance of software applications or services in the field of Artificial Intelligence (AI) in different technologies such as Natural Language Processing (NLP), Machine Learning (ML), Information Extraction, Knowledge Graphs (KG) or Graph Data Science (GDS);
  • Market studies and technical evaluation of advanced commercial or open-source products or services in the above fields;
  • Prompt engineering on Large Language Models and validation of results with the business/policy officers;
  • Interact with policy officers, data stewards and other stakeholders to understand business and data needs, turn them into use cases, prototypes or statements of work and eventually support the solution acceptance process;
  • Design the IT architecture and hosting solutions and coordinate its implementation considering cloud technologies, containers, DevOps, master- and meta data management concepts and security.


Requirements


  • Master's degree in IT or relevant discipline, combined with minimum 15 years of relevant working experience in IT;
  • Minimum 8 years' of specific expertise in Perl, Python, Matlab, R and their NLP/ML libraries (SpaCy, NLTK, scikit-learn, pandas...);
  • Minimum 8 years' of specific expertise in machine learning techniques and algorithms, such as k-NN, Naive Bayes, SVM, Decision Forests, Neural Network, and/or artificial intelligence frameworks as well as Large Language Model prompt engineering;
  • Minimum 7 years' of specific expertise in query languages, such as SQL, Hive, Pig, etc and with information extraction;
  • Minimum 5 years' of specific expertise in data management and analytics, including data quality as well as advanced data retrieval tools;
  • Minimum 5 years' of specific expertise in AWS, Azure or other cloud platforms;
  • Minimum 5 years' of specific expertise in machine learning systems lifecycle;
  • Minimum 5 years' of specific expertise in software development methodologies such as Agile or RUP;
  • Minimum 5 years' of specific expertise in NoSQL databases, such as MongoDB, Cassandra, HBase, Neo4j, etc.;
  • Minimum 5 years' of specific expertise in data analytics over big datasets, non-structured databases as well as data lakes, including data visualization tools (e.g. D3.js, knowledge graphs, etc.);
  • Minimum 5 years' of specific expertise in applied statistics, such as distributions, statistical testing, regression, etc.;
  • The following certifications would be considered as an asset: AWS Certified Machine Learning, Microsoft Azure AI Engineer Associate SAS Certified Professional AI and Machine Learning Certification;
  • Excellent command of the English language, French would be an asset.


Benefits

If you are seeking a career in an exciting, dynamic and multicultural international environment with exciting opportunities that will boost your career, please send us your detailed CV in English, quoting reference: (17837/10/2024).

We offer a competitive remuneration (either on contract basis or remuneration with full benefits package), based on qualifications and experience. All applications will be treated as confidential.

You may also consider all our other open vacancies by visiting the career section of our web site (www.eurodyn.com) and follow us on Twitter (@EURODYN_Careers) and LinkedIn.

EUROPEAN DYNAMICS (www.eurodyn.com)is a leading Software, Information and Communication Technologies company, operating internationally (Athens, Brussels, Luxembourg, Copenhagen, Berlin, Stockholm, London, Nicosia, Valetta, Vienna, Den Haag, Hong Kong, etc.) The company employs over 1000 engineers, IT experts and consultants (around 3% PhD, 36% MSc and 53% BSc or equivalent). We design and develop software applications using integrated state-of-the-art technology. Our current IT projects have a value exceeding 300 million EURO. EUROPEAN DYNAMICS is a renowned supplier of IT services to European Union Institutions, international organizations, European Agencies and national government Administrations in 40 countries and 4 continents..

As part of our dedication to the diversity of our workforce, we are committed to Equal Employment Opportunity without regard for race, color, national origin, ethnicity, gender, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, or religion.

EUROPEAN DYNAMICS (ED) adheres to the General Data Protection Regulation principles by applying its Privacy Policy as published in www.eurodyn.com/privacy. By submitting an application to this position and by sharing your personal data with ED, you acknowledge and accept its Policy and authorise ED to process your personal data for the purposes of the company's recruitment opportunities, in line to the Policy.

Title: Python Developer
Description:
We are seeking a flexible and dynamic Python Developer who is excited about working in a role where daily tasks may vary and where projects evolve frequently. This role will require collaboration with business analysts and stakeholders to understand business needs, as well as direct involvement in technical development. The ideal candidate is comfortable with changing requirements, enjoys working in an agile environment, and thrives on a mix of tasks, from API integration to data analysis.

Key responsibilities


API integration and Access
Develop and maintain code for connecting to various external APIs
Understand and implement the authentication and authorization processes required to securely access APIs
Ensure data accessed from APIs is correctly integrated into our systems and is available for business stakeholders as needed.
Stay updated on API documentation to handle changes in API structures or endpoints
Dynamic Data handling
Implement solutions to gather, process, and provide insights from real-time data that is critical to business decision-making
Integrate data from APIs, ensuring data quality and availability to the business
Capture, log, and report the dates and times of API access for auditing and reporting purposes
Collaborate with business analysts and stakeholders
Work closely with business analysts to translate business requirements into actionable technical specifications
Proactively communicate with business stakeholders to ensure clarity on requirements and the impact of development changes
Take initiative to address gaps in requirements and propose solutions to meet business needs
Agile development and continuous improvement
Participate actively in agile workflows, including sprint planning, daily stand-ups, and retrospectives
Contribute to ongoing improvements in development practices, focusing on speed, flexibility, and quality of work
Adapt to the evolving nature of the projects, quickly adjusting priorities and tasks based on stakeholder feedback and business changes
Quality assurance and deployment
Write and maintain tests to ensure code quality and reliability in a constantly evolving environment
Document and test solutions rigorously to ensure they meet business requirements and handle potential data inconsistencies
Deploy solutions in a secure, reliable, and scalable manner, with clear documentation for ongoing support and maintenance
Show more

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Your mission :

Join Partenamut, Belgium's first free, French-speaking mutual insurance company, and embark on a professional and personal journey where people are at the heart of everything. Here, we are ready to build the mutuality of tomorrow even more attentive and innovative. Every day, we support more than 1.3 million customers in proactively managing their health, but above all, we form a collaborative and supportive team. Your talents and individuality are freely expressed to achieve our common goals.

We believe in human-centred fulfilment, innovation, solidarity and diversity. If you're passionate about innovation and people, if you're prepared to go the extra mile for our customers while remaining whole, and if you like to challenge yourself at work while enjoying your free time, we look forward to meeting you so that together we can build the health and well-being of tomorrow.




Your responsabilities :

Daily :

You process and combine structured and unstructured data from various natures to develop innovative solutions solving identified business needs and opening new possibilities.
You evaluate, validate and productize your developments, in collaboration with relevant colleagues.
You exchange with your squad members (PO, Data Engineers, Data Analysts, RPA) to make sure the solutions are meeting the business needs and are efficiently implemented. You actively take part in the (agile) life of the squad.
You collaborate with other colleagues according to the needs (architect, DPO, DevOps, business…). This way you ensure your developments are compliant, you grow the knowledge of colleagues and you identify new opportunities.
You contribute to the continuous improvement of the team's way of working, by defining and insuring the use of good practices in diverse areas such as Documentation, (ML)Ops, Software Engineering, Monitoring, collaboration…
You have fun collaborating with amazing colleagues and discussing fascinating (non-)work related topics.




Your profile as a senior Data Scientist :

You have a Master’s degree or a PhD, preferably in Computer Science, Mathematics or Data Science. Anyway, independently of your background, you have a big affinity with Data and IT, together with a strong analytical mindset.
You have at least 7 years of experience working as a Data Scientist / ML Engineer, and at least 3 years of experience extracting information from unstructured data (text and image). In particular, you have successfully deployed Large Language Models to solve actual business problems.
You are fully comfortable with the main ML/AI principles and algorithms and have experience developing ML models from structured data as well.
You have experience developing and maintaining such assets on AWS. You are fluent in Python. Knowledge of SQL is an asset. Practical experience of implementing MLOps good practices is a strong asset.
You have a strong work ethic, can work autonomously as well as collaborating with colleagues from various backgrounds (data engineering, data translators, data analysts) You are not afraid of being proactive regarding the choice of a technical solution or the proposal of new directions to explore. In other words, you contribute to our team objective of being an inspiration force for our colleagues and the company.
Next to your technical skills, you love solving actual problems. You are creative but pragmatic regarding the use of AI and are also able to explain complex topics in clear and simple terms. You are also curious about latest developments in the field of AI.
You have English and French full business proficiency. Dutch is an asset.
You don't tick all checkboxes, but you are a quick learner and are confident you can soon catch up.




Our offer :

A full-time open-ended contract with flexible working hours and the possibility of remote working up to 3 days a week.
An exciting position with real prospects in a fast-growing company.
In-depth training in the mutual insurance sector on arrival and regular training throughout your career.
An attractive salary with numerous non-statutory benefits that can be adapted to suit your needs.
Up to 46 days of leave per year.

Merci de noter qu’aucune candidature envoyée par un bureau de consultance externe ne sera acceptée si le bureau n’a pas été expressément mandaté pour cette recherche par Partenamut.

Title: Data Scientist (NL or FR + EN)
Description:
Founded in 2020 in Belgium, ATS4IT is part of the Moongy Group, established to strengthen agap2IT’s presence in Europe.

Since 2021 we expanded further with the opening of our Danish branch in Copenhagen, and our Spanish brand in Madrid, reinforcing our commitment to being a key player in the European technology landscape.

Proximity, transparency, and collaboration define our approach at ATS. We aim to be your trusted partner and the first choice for your technological challenges

Position: Data Scientist

Location: Brussels, Belgium

Work Mode: Hybrid (2 to 3 days per week on-site)

Required Languages: Dutch or French (native) + English (advanced level)

Candidates must be in Europe already

Technical and Soft Skills:


Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, or a related field
At least 4 years as a data scientist or similar, with proven experience in developing and implementing algorithms for algorithmic trading
Proficient in implementing AI/ML models for trading purposes
Strong understanding of financial markets and trading strategies
Strong ability to write Python code for model implementation, training, and feature engineering.
Experience in setting up Azure Machine Learning and Data Factory pipelines.
Familiarity with AzureDevOps, including CI/CD, backlog management, and sprint planning.
Fluent English is mandatory;
Fluent in Dutch or French is Mandatory.



What We Offer


DKV Insurance
Free training (technical, behavioral, language) and certifications
Continuous and personalized career progression support
Opportunities to work on projects with cutting-edge technologies
Opportunity to work in a global network of companies, with access to a wide range of challenging projects in different European markets.



At ATS4IT, part of the agap2IT family, we promote equality and value diversity. We foster a safe, inclusive environment where opportunities are equal for all. We welcome applications from individuals of all backgrounds, based solely on merit.

Join us and be part of the future!
